thread.title: 7 new Vegas shows with tickets on sale this week |
thread.title_full: 7 new Vegas shows with tickets on sale this week | Las Vegas Review-Journal

author: Dave Herrera
title: 7 new Vegas shows with tickets on sale this week |
text:
Check out these six shows announced with tickets going on sale this week: 
While this year’s Soul Train Awards Weekend is taking place from Thursday, Nov. 5 though Sunday, Nov. 8 ., you’ll want to mark Saturday, Nov. 7 on your calendar, particularly if you’re a fan of R. Kelly, Babyface or Common. That’s when the three of them are set to perform at Mandalay Events Center. Tickets for that show start at $49.95 and go on sale this Friday at 10 a.m. The awards ceremony itself, meanwhile, is slated for Friday, Nov. 6 at Orleans with an afterparty scheduled to follow at LIGHT Nightclub at Mandalay Bay. 
Adam Lambert, who just dropped his latest video for "Another Lonely Night," which was filmed here in Las Vegas, is set to perform at the Joint at the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino with Rob Thomas from Matchbox 20 on Saturday, Dec. 5 , as part of Mix 94.1 Mercedes in the Morning's No So Silent Night. Tickets for the show start at $39.50 and go on sale on Friday at 10 a.m. 

Selena Gomez is set to kick off her upcoming tour in support of "Revival," her latest album, here in Las Vegas. The former child star and rising pop singer, who shared last week about her recent health struggle and how she endured chemotherapy to treat lupus, is slated to appear at Mandalay Bay Events Center on Friday, May 6. Tickets for the show range from $46.95 to $126 and go on sale Saturday at 10 a.m. 

Reba, Brooks & Dunn, who are set to resume their Las Vegas residency just before the holidays, have added seven more dates to their itenerary, including one in the midst of their December run, and a half dozen next May. Tickets for the additional dates of REBA, BROOKS & DUNN: Together in Vegas ( Monday, Dec. 7 and May 3 , 6, 7, 10, 13 and 14) range from $59.50 to $205 and go on sale Friday at 10 a.m. 

The Brooklyn Bowl has a trio of shows going on sale this week. The first features local rapper Dizzy Wright with Hopsin, plus Jarren Benton and DJ Hoppa on Friday, Nov. 20. Tickets range from $25-$45 and go on sale Friday at 10 a.m. John Brown's Body, meanwhile, is due at the Brooklyn Bowl on Monday, Dec. 14 . Tickets for that show are $15-$17 and go on sale Friday at 10 a.m. And Monica is set to make a stop in Vegas on Thursday, Nov. 12 with Rico Love. Tickets are $25-$40 and go on sale at 10 a.m. on Friday . Part of this year's EDC...
